name: Save the Children Federation
mission: Children works to ensure that children, their mothers and other caregivers have access to and use key health and nutrition services, as well as adopt healthy behaviors in both development and emergency situations.
theoryOfChange: Save the Children Federation has a published 'Global Sponsorship Theory of Change' which guides program design, implementation, monitoring, adaptive management, and evaluating transformational change. Their 'Breakthrough Innovations for Children' document also outlines 'OUR THEORY OF CHANGE'. Additionally, Save the Children has a 'Framework for Anticipatory Action' to create a common understanding and mitigate the impact of future crises. They also have a 'Global Strategy 2025-2027: Partnering with Children to Change the World' which focuses on tackling the root causes of child rights violations and achieving impact in four priority areas: a healthy start in life, safe in schools and learning, living free from violence, and safety nets and resilient families. Save the Children also utilizes logic models, as evidenced by the 'Logic Model for the Save The Children Future Parents Program' and their 'FIELD Logic Models' training module which covers Theory of Change, Results Framework, and Logical Framework.

dimension_explanations.alignment: Save the Children addresses urgent humanitarian needs, making it a suitable choice for sadaqah-eligible giving [6]. While it has a long track record of success, it maintains a medium donor fit for those seeking specialized alignment [1][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high impact through direct service delivery, maintaining a Charity Navigator score of 98.25/100 and a program expense ratio of 84.9% [1][2]. Its initiatives have contributed to fewer child deaths and reduced stunting globally [3][5].

baseline_narrative.headline: Save the Children Federation, Inc. provides critical health, education, and emergency services to ensure children and caregivers thrive in both stable and crisis environments.
strengths: High financial efficiency with a program expense ratio of 84.9%
Strong fundraising efficiency, spending only $0.09 per $1 raised
Robust liquidity with 4.0 months of working capital
baseline_narrative.summary: Save the Children Federation, Inc. works to improve access to essential health and nutrition services while promoting healthy behaviors for children and their caregivers [1][4]. The organization operates large-scale programs in education and emergency response, supported by a total revenue of $919,334,410 [2].

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value established institutional stability and want their contributions to support large-scale, multi-sectoral humanitarian interventions for children globally.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade A reflects verified outcome tracking across multiple years and the publication of detailed impact reports.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The organization uses a documented theory of change focused on ensuring children survive, learn, and are protected through health services, education, and emergency response.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that large-scale spending translates into measurable improvements in child mortality and literacy.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: As a major responder in Gaza, Syria, and Sudan, the organization has a high capacity to absorb additional funding for emergency relief.
strategic_priorities: Ensure all children survive, learn and are protected by 2030

strengths.detail: The organization holds <cite id="8">a near-perfect 98.25/100 rating from Charity Navigator</cite> and meets <cite id="9">all 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance Standards</cite> for charity accountability.
Save the Children demonstrated significant reach in 2024 by ensuring <cite id="4">7.5 million children were learning</cite> and conducting <cite id="10">23 surgical and medical missions</cite>.
The charity maintains <cite id="11">4.0 months of working capital</cite>, providing a robust buffer to sustain operations during global crises.

strengths_deep_dive: Save the Children's operational strength lies in its ability to combine massive financial resources with direct service delivery. With <cite id="2">over $910 million in annual contributions</cite>, they manage a complex grantmaking and implementation network that distributed <cite id="12">$550.7 million in foreign grants</cite> in 2023. Their impact is longitudinal; since 2019, their advocacy and programs have contributed to <cite id="13">4.4 million fewer child deaths per year</cite> and <cite id="13">115 million fewer children being out of school</cite> globally. This is supported by a governance structure featuring an <cite id="14">independent board of 33 members</cite> and a Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid.
rich_narrative.summary: Save the Children Federation, Inc. is a global humanitarian leader that has been operating since <cite id="1">its founding in 1919</cite> to ensure children and caregivers have access to essential health, education, and emergency services. The organization manages a massive scale of operations, reporting <cite id="2">total revenue of $919,334,410</cite> in the 2023 tax year. Their work is characterized by a multi-sectoral approach, including <cite id="3">newborn health services, malnutrition screening, and basic education</cite> across the United States and international crisis zones such as Syria, Gaza, and Afghanistan. In 2024 alone, the federation reported <cite id="4">supporting 28.9 million children</cite> and reaching <cite id="5">30.9 million people through emergency response efforts</cite>. Financially, the organization maintains high efficiency, directing <cite id="6">84.9% of its total expenses toward programs</cite> while spending only <cite id="7">$0.09 to raise every $1</cite> in charitable contributions. This scale and efficiency are backed by <cite id="8">a 98.25/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting a high degree of transparency and organizational health.
